verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrahim (Abraham) his (portion of) guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him (as to his Belief in the Oneness of Allah, etc.).

verse.author: Sarwar
verse.text: Abraham asked his father and his people, "What are these statues which you worship?"

verse.author: Qarai
verse.text: They said, ‘We found our fathers worshipping them.’

verse.author: Wahiduddin Khan
verse.text: Abraham said, "Indeed, you and your fathers have been clearly misguided."

verse.author: Qarai
verse.text: They said, ‘Are you telling the truth, or are you [just] kidding?’

verse.author: Wahiduddin Khan
verse.text: Abraham replied, "Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them, and I bear witness to that.

verse.author: Sarwar
verse.text: Abraham said to himself, "By God! I will devise a plan against their idols when they are away."

verse.author: Qarai
verse.text: So he broke them into pieces—all except the biggest of them—so that they might come back to it.

verse.author: Qarai
verse.text: They said, ‘Whoever has done this to Our gods?! He is indeed a wrongdoer!’

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: They said: "We heard a young man talking (against) them who is called Ibrahim (Abraham)."

verse.author: Qarai
verse.text: They said, ‘Bring him before the people’s eyes so that they may bear witness [against him].’

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)?"

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them (idols) did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"

verse.author: Qarai
verse.text: Thereat they came to themselves and said [to one another], ‘Indeed it is you who are the wrongdoers!’

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: Then they turned to themselves (their first thought and said): "Indeed you [Ibrahim (Abraham)] know well that these (idols) speak not!"

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you then worship besides Allah, things that can neither profit you, nor harm you?

verse.author: Qarai
verse.text: Fie on you and what you worship besides Allah! Do you not exercise your reason?’

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father Azar: "Do you take idols as aliha (gods)? Verily, I see you and your people in manifest error.

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: Thus did we show Ibrahim (Abraham) the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he be one of those who have Faith with certainty.

verse.author: Sarwar
verse.text: When it became dark at night, he (Abraham) saw a star and said, "This is my lord." But when it disappeared, he said, "I do not love those who fade away".

verse.author: Sarwar
verse.text: When Abraham saw the rising moon, he said, "This is my lord." But when it faded away, he said, "If my Lord does not guide me I shall certainly go astray."

verse.author: Sarwar
verse.text: When he saw the rising sun, he said, "This is my Lord for it is greater (than the others)." But when this too faded away, (Abraham) said, "My people, I disavow whatever you consider equal to God.

verse.author: Arberry
verse.text: I have turned my face to Him who originated the heavens and the earth, a man of pure faith; I am not of the idolaters.'

verse.author: Sarwar
verse.text: In an argument with his people, (Abraham) asked them, "Why do you argue with me about God who has given me guidance? Your idols can do no harm to me unless God wills. God knows all things. Why, then, do you not consider this?

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: And that was Our Proof which We gave Ibrahim (Abraham) against his people. We raise whom We will in degrees. Certainly your Lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: And mention in the Book (the Quran) Ibrahim (Abraham). Verily! He was a man of truth, a Prophet.

verse.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
verse.text: When he said to his father,* “O my father – why do you worship one which neither hears nor sees, and cannot benefit you in any way?” (* His uncle Azar.)

verse.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
verse.text: “O my father, indeed a knowledge has come to me which did not come to you – therefore follow me, I will show you the Straight Path.”

verse.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
verse.text: “O my father, do not be a bondman of the devil; indeed the devil is disobedient towards the Most Gracious.”

verse.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
verse.text: “O my father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Gracious may reach you, so you would become a companion of the devil.”

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: He (the father) said: "Do you reject my gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)? If you stop not (this), I will indeed stone you. So get away from me safely before I punish you."

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "Peace be on you! I will ask Forgiveness of my Lord for you. Verily! He is unto me, Ever Most Gracious.

verse.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
verse.text: "And I shall remain separated from you and all that you worship other than Allah and shall worship my Lord; possibly, by worshipping my Lord, I will not be amongst the unfortunate.”

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim (Abraham).

verse.author: Sarwar
verse.text: Tell them the story of Abraham,

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: (Abraham) asked: "Do they hear when you call them?

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: Or do they benefit you, or do you harm?"

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: They said: "No. But we found our fathers doing so."

verse.author: Wahiduddin Khan
verse.text: Abraham said, "Have you really thought about what you have been worshipping,

verse.author: Sarwar
verse.text: (Abraham) said, "Do you know that what you worship and what your grandfathers worshipped

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: Yet they are my enemies except the Lord of all the worlds

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: Who created me and showed me the way,

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: Who gives me food and drink,

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: And heals me when I am sick,

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: Who will make me die, then give me life again,

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: And who, I hope, will condone my faults on the Day of Judgement.

verse.author: Maududi
verse.text: (And then Abraham prayed): "My Lord, endow me with knowledge and wisdom and join me with the righteous,

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: And uphold my name with posterity,

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: And put me among the inheritors of Paradise.

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: Forgive me and my father: He was surely among those who went astray.

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: And do not disgrace me on the day when they are raised from the graves,

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: The day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail

verse.author: Ahmed Ali
verse.text: But to him who comes to God with a tranquil heart."

verse.author: Hilali & Khan
verse.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father and his people: "Verily, I am innocent of what you worship,
